result.execSummary:
The defendant Richard K Rowell was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Richard K Rowell is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Richard K Rowell was found guilty of Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Richard K Rowell was found guilty of Entry into/onto Bldg/Constuct.Site/Room [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.15(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Each ct concur. W/h adjudication on ct 3. Def can request ct 3 be dismissed upon successful completion of probation & no new charges or ATR's.

miscConds.notes: $200 DNA surcharge remitted. $253  to be collected by the Dept of Corrections.  Court financial obligations shall be paid at the rate of 25% of the prison wages and work release funds.  Restitution shall be paid pursuant to separate court order.  The balance remaining at release from prison be paid as a condition of extended supervison or parole at a rate determined by the supervising agent.
Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Legacy Academy, Fitchburg.
Any other conditions DOC, Probation/Parole Department may impose.

timeConds.notes: With huber. Consec to Grant Co Case.

miscConds.notes: $243  to be collected by the Dept of Corrections.
All other conditions are the same as count 1 (except jail time).
